Key Match Events: Gibraltar frustrated Scotland in a 0-2 defeat
Hankins made a massive save in the 35th minute, keeping out a header from a corner from Hanley
Hankins made a comfortable save in the 55th minute from a header bounced to the ground by Cooper
Scotland broke the deadlock in the 57th minute when Christie collected a ball that went over the defense and found a gap between defenders, slamming the ball into the net from close range
Adams scored a goal in the 84th minute, greeted with warm applause from silent Scottish fans
Pre-Game Insights: Gibraltar started with a surprising lineup, featuring Hankins getting his first call-up to the senior team
Twice-capped James Scanlon also started for the first time, just one match away from deciding whether to stay with Gibraltar
Gibraltar played a defensive line, now becoming a core of the team, but with Lope taking over the role of leader with Roy Chipolina missing from the first eleven
Post-Match Reflections: Gibraltar will now be tested on Thursday when they face Wales, who did not qualify for the Euros
This match is likely to see a different attitude on the field from their opponents
For players such as Hankins making his debut the result would have also been satisfactory having kept Scotland to just two goal and maintained their discipline throughout
However, a lack of attempts at goal with the just two attempts maintains Gibraltar very low record offensively
Miscellaneous Highlights: A water break was given by the match official after 23 minutes due to high temperature on the pitch
Gibraltar fans were content with the performance, unlike ten years ago when they first played Scotland and had been level at 1-all at halftime
Gibraltar will face Wales, who did not qualify for the Euros, on Thursday
